meanings.definition: A person who is lazy and avoids work.
meanings.sent1: The town had a few layabouts who never helped with any chores.
meanings.sent2: The park was filled with layabouts lounging on the benches all day.
meanings.sent3: The layabouts decided to have a contest to see who could nap the longest.
meanings.sent4: The lazy cat was the true layabout of the household, always sleeping in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The image of the layabouts lazing around in the park stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are idle and do not contribute to society.
meanings.sent1: The neighborhood was known for its group of layabouts who never volunteered for anything.
meanings.sent2: The city council tried to find ways to motivate the layabouts to be more active in the community.
meanings.sent3: The layabouts formed a club where they discussed the best ways to avoid responsibilities.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathered over the town, casting a shadow on the layabouts who refused to lend a hand.
meanings.sent5: The image of the layabouts sitting idly while others worked hard was a stark reminder of their lack of contribution.
